unnormalised: Breaking news! Looks like the USD to INR exchange rate is fluctuating quite a bit today. Started the day at ₹83.25 per $1, but already saw it dip to ₹83.10 and then jump back up. Analysts are saying it's due to some global market activity and FIIs (Foreign Institutional Investors) are playing a big role.
normalised: Breaking news! Looks like the U-S-D to I-N-R exchange rate is fluctuating quite a bit today. Started the day at rupee eighty three point two five per dollar one, but already saw it dip to rupee eighty three point one zero and then jump back up. Analysts are saying it's due to some global market activity and F-I-I-s (Foreign Institutional Investors) are playing a big role.

unnormalised: Apparently, the Euro is also having a bit of a moment against the Rupee. Earlier, you could get around ₹89.50 for every 1 EUR, but now it’s hovering closer to ₹90. Experts suggest keeping an eye on RBI's announcements this week; could affect things.
normalised: Apparently, the Euro is also having a bit of a moment against the Rupee. Earlier, you could get around rupee eighty nine point five zero for every one E-U-R, but now it’s hovering closer to rupee ninety. Experts suggest keeping an eye on R-B-I's announcements this week; could affect things.

unnormalised: And if you're planning a trip to the UK, the GBP is still pretty strong. Saw rates of around ₹105 for £1 earlier, but shop around! My cousin just got a better rate from Thomas Cook – apparently got ₹104.75 per Pound. Always pays to check before you convert, right?
normalised: And if you're planning a trip to the U-K, the G-B-P is still pretty strong. Saw rates of around rupee one hundred and five for pound one earlier, but shop around! My cousin just got a better rate from Thomas Cook – apparently got rupee one hundred and four point seven five per Pound. Always pays to check before you convert, right?
